reviews.review_text: Unless you have gamepad, do not buy until they have mouse support.  The keyboard control is very awful.

Another one of KOEI Tecmo's amazing ports  Avoid at all costs If you want a run down of their track record so far just look for other games and look at the reviews on Steam The only good ones worth mentioning would be both Dynasty Warriors 8XLCE and Dynasty Warriors 8: Empires   Pros: Monster Hunter Style Gameplay Online  Cons: Locked 30FPS in the year 2015 THE YEAR 2015 DID I MENTION IT WAS 2015? Framerate dips to 20 during dialogue Framerate dips 25 or lower during fighting (The more crucial parts where you DO NOT want frame drops) Absurd amount of money for a game more than a year old that has been ported to hell and back No Keyboard and Mouse Support (At least mention that it is required to have a Gamepad to somehow enjoy the game)   Vague and I mean VAGUE system requirements For example:  (And this is the Recommended one) OS: Windows Vista/7/8/8.1 (64bit required)  Processor: Core i7 2600 3.4GHz or better  Memory: 4 GB RAM  Graphics: 1980*1080 pixel over, True Color  DirectX: Version 11  Network: Broadband Internet connection  Hard Drive: 21 GB available space  Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c over  What does that even tell us 'Graphics: 1920x1080 pixel over, True Color' WHAT?!   I wish I could describe the game a bit more, but the ugly state that it is in prevents me from doing so. Thank you Steam for giving us the option to Refund the game  I'm a fan of KOEI, but with these kinds of releases they're shooting themselves in the foot.  REMEMBER CONSOLE GAMING IS A PRIORITY FOR THEM DON'T EXPECT THEM TO GIVE AS MUCH ATTENTION TO THE PC MARKET

Pro: - Simple game to pick up and play, especially if you're familiar with Monster Hunter - Missions are usually not too long (15min or less) - Built in system that allows AI to go on missions you've beaten for loot, so less tedious farming for crafting - Many weapons/mitamas (souls) to equip and collect - Monster Variety  Cons: - Gameplay is not as challenging or unique as Monster Hunter - Armor selection isn't high or as crucial as other game - The weapon selection isn't as balanced, e.g. Monster Hunter gives you a reason to try almost each weapon  Should you play it: If you are like me, who love MH and crave a game to play with friends, this is worth it on sale ($25). The gameplay is simpler and eventually it feels less challenging. I did not find any issues in the locked framerate and performance as I'm accustomed to console experience for these types of games. Definitely if you have a friend that wants to play with you, not worth full price. I enjoyed this at a discount.

I didn't even format my PC since I installed Windows in 2012... so, it feels like most of the complains come from people that can't use a PC and should just stick with consoles. There's a 30 FPS cap yes and it would be better to play it more fluidly at 60, but the game is really fun and plays perfectly, and as I said, I didn't feel any frame drops, 30 steady FPS are still good and it's the same performance as on PS4 (also, this is a PS4 port). Plays perfectly with an 360 Xbox Controller, too. Haven't tested keyboard controls but people should just use a controller with these kind of games.  The game is really fun and totally worth a 50% discount (not sure if it's worth 100% of its price though, will probably update opinions when I finish the game.)

This game has been receiving some bad reviews calling it a horrible port. I am writing my first ever steam review to say it is fact a great, very fun game. Also TLDR version at very bottom.  Negatives (Not really)  I only truly see two “issues” with this game really. The lack of mouse/keyboard, and the 30 FPS lock. The 30 FPS lock is not an issue to me as this game runs VERY smooth for me. I have had no stutters, glitches, or crashes in my 15 hours of play. Granted I have a EVGA Windforce GTX 770 4gb card, but I am playing with every setting maxed, and I feel lesser hardware should run this fine. The mouse/keyboard may been a huge problem for some people. This game is designed for a controller, and ported with one in mind, plain and simple. There are no keyboard buttons on screen, and even using a keyboard and mouse everything on screen still refers to X,Y,A,B keys. Koei has a problem with doing this on their latest ports as Dynasty Warriors 8: Empire did the same, but in reverse as it only showed keyboard commands in game. As I only use controllers for these types of game, that game did bother the HELL out of me, so I can see the keyboard/mouse community's issues here.  Positives  This is a Monster Hunter style game on pc, plain and simple if you are into that sort of thing. There a quite a few different maps to run around, varied monsters, and crafting to make bigger better weapons to slay with. The game is faster paced than Monster Hunter, but is still slower than Dynasty Warriors. Add to this a pseudo spell system and different weapon types and styles; you end up with a surprisingly deep game once you start trying out different weapons and skill builds.  The story is pretty good. Nothing super deep or profound, but it does give you a reason to kill all those demons, and I genuinely find myself liking many of the characters as you get to interact with them and learn their back stories.   Online – There is up to 4 player co-op through the games missions, and I can say it is hella fun (if you can find other people to play with). Some folks say their game had horrible online syncing, well as far as I can tell there is no server based gameplay. If the host has crap internet then you will experience lag. I hosted my own online matches, and had no issues with the other players syncing. If you want to minimize the potential for lag go into the settings and tell it to only connect to other English players. I have never seen a Japan hosted game ever run smoothly.  TLDR  If you want a fun Monster Hunter style game on pc, this game is great; as long as you don’t mind using a controller. It wont ever receive the glorious pc master race seal of approval for its port job, but as long as you aren’t “trying to run it on a potato” (a quote from my best friend) you should have a great experience with many hours of play ahead of you.

Edit: Didn't think anyone would have seen my review so I decided to add more to it.  Unless capcom ports a Monster Hunter for PC this is as good as it gets. It's not a bad game by any means in terms of gameplay though there's not much else I can say that hasn't been covered by other reviews I'm only really recommending this game because I my self love it. Though plenty of people are bashing at the game for being a bad port I my self and a group of other friends are not having any issues with the game at all.

In the six months that the game has been out there has been no support for users and the latest update has made the game playable in mission but unbareably slow in the simple hub town droping the frames down to less than 15. The game is also locked solid on 30 frames and before you ask yes you can unlock the frame limit say to run a 60 frames that game is unplayable because yes the game runs at 60 frames but the game speed is then doubled making it unplayable for anyone.  Do I like this game?: yes I really like this game in the few hours I have played it I have loved it all (minus the few issues stated)  Do I recommend it?: no if you want to play Toukiden I honestly think you're better off getting it for a console as much as I hate to say it

To rule out crashing issues and low FPS, see the bottom of my review.   Despite the hostility towards this game in other reviews, I decided to give it a shot and see how it went. I won't lie, so far I'm quite impressed. There are issues in the current state of the game, however I trust that these will be fixed, judging by the fact that the developers have already address and fixed some crashing issues.   Pros:     Gameplay is lots of fun    Voice acting is fantastic    Translation is great    Very well rendered cutscenes/cinematics    Lots of playtime    Very diverse and flexible playstyle to suit anyone    Cons:     30fps lock, however is not very noticeable when playing and does not cause input lag    Glitches where particles, effects and lighting is not rendered properly (does not affect gameplay)    Still some crashing issues and compatibility issues with Windows 8.1 (however fixable)    Appears to be some issues with keyboard/mouse, however I'm using an Xbox 360 controller   In the current state of the game, it is playable by all means, as long as you do the following:     Set all graphics settings to lowest    In your Steam client, right-click on the game, go to 'Properties' > 'Local Files' tab > 'Browse Local Files...' and in that folder for the 3 exe files, right-click and click 'Properties', and under the 'Compatibility' tab, tick 'Run this program in compatibility for:' and select Windows 7, also in the same tab, under 'Settings', click 'Run this program as an administrator'   So long as you follow these steps, you won't have any issues with gameplay. Have fun.

Let's start with the actual review first. I haven't gotten super far into the game yet, but it seems promising and I've been enjoying it so far. This game is basically like Monster Hunter without all the unecessary fluff. Each weapon plays different and as a game by Toei, if you're expecting combat along the lines of Dynasty Warriors, you'd be mistaken. Each weapon handles quite differently from not only just simple things like attack speed and range, but also basically having different controls for each weapon. Though some button combos are the same, the result is different for each weapon.   Now for all you people complaining about bugs, awful controls, and other stuff, the only problem I've had with this game is random crashing, which I'm sure they can fix soon enough. It also seems running in compatibility mode helps out with this. People complain about no use of mouse, but Dynasty Warriors was the same way. It just takes getting used to. My controller wouldn't even work for Dynasty Warriors but I just kept using the keyboard and I don't even care anymore. If you're that stuck up about it, go buy yourself a controller (Xbox 360 probably). It's a surprise you already don't have one if you play tons of different games on PC. Can't afford one? Not my problem, not Toei's problem. I've heard there's an issue with not being able to setup your own keybindings, and for that, I have nothing against since I myself had to change some key binding to play Dynasty Warriors on the keyboard.   Oh, and the last thing. Locked at 30 FPS? Who cares  So basically, this game is great, the only problem which is completely fixable is the random crashes. No need to whine about problems you could easily work around or that don't even matter
Pretty fun game, shame about the porting issues.  Get it on sale I guess.
